data.title: Fox Fisher on LinkedIn: #lgbtq #inclusion #diversity #belonging #community #history
data.meta_description: Did you know that lavender has a fascinating history in the LGBTQ+ community? In the 1920s, the term "lavender boy" was used to describe gay men who wereâ€¦
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

Did you know that lavender has a fascinating history in the LGBTQ+ community? In the 1920s, the term "lavender boy" was used to describe gay men who were accused of not being masculine enough. Even Abraham Lincoln was once referred to as "lavender" by a historian. Lavender became associated with lesbians who wanted to be included in the women's movement. In 1970, activists disrupted a women's event wearing T-shirts that read "Lavender Menace" to fight against discrimination. The crowd welcomed them into the fold, and in 1971, lesbian rights became a "legitimate concern of feminism." As a business, it's important to understand the cultural importance of LGBTQIA+ history. By recognising and celebrating the resilience and strength of our community's history, we can create a more inclusive workplace and foster a sense of belonging for all employees. Let's continue to learn from our past and work towards a more equitable future for everyone. #LGBTQ+ #inclusion #diversity #belonging #community #history
